Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.addResource(String, String, boolean...)
    Add the resources specified in the body contents to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'. The RADL restrictions are the same as in RPC-XML AddResource
    If success, it is returned a list of URIs of the new virtual machines.
    The context parameter is optional and is a flag to specify if the contextualization step will be launched just after the VM addition.
    As default the contextualization flag is set to True.
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.alterVM(String, String, String)
    Change the features of the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' in the infrastructure with with ID 'infId', specified by the RADL document specified in the body contents.
    Return a RADL with information about the virtual machine, like GetVMInfo.
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.createInfrastructure(String)
    Create and configure an infrastructure with the requirements specified in the TOSCA document of the body content.
    If success, it is returned the URI of the new infrastructure.
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.getVMInfo(String, String)
    Return information about the virtual machine with ID vmId associated to the infrastructure with ID infId.
    The returned string is in RADL format.
    See more the details of the output in GetVMInfo
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.getVMProperty(String, String, String)
    Return property 'propertyName' from to the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'.
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.getVMProperty(String, String, String, boolean)
    Return property 'propertyName' from to the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'.
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.getVMProperty(String, String, VmProperties)
    Return property 'propertyName' from to the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'.
    es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient.reconfigure(String, String, int...)
    Perform the reconfigure action in all the virtual machines in the the infrastructure with ID 'infID.' It updates the configuration of the infrastructure as indicated in the 'radlFile'. The RADL restrictions are the same as in RPC-XML Reconfigure
    If no RADL are specified, the contextualization process is started again. The 'vmList' parameter is optional and is a comma separated array of IDs of the VMs to reconfigure. If not specified all the VMs will be reconfigured.
